titleStmt.title: B. F. Luten et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5334

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: We the undersigned Citizens of Trigg County respectfully states that one W. D. Vickers was Indicted by the Grand Jury of this County for "permitting Gaming in his House" and was tried and the February Term of the Trigg Cir. Court and fined Two Hundred Dollars. We further state that there was only one Game played in his house, and the testimony showed conclusively that said Vickers was not at home at the time the game was played and had no Knowledge of the gaming whatever. And further that Mr Vickers is a hard working poor man with a family and a good civil law abiding citizen
We therefore earnestly petition your Excellency to remit that portion of said fine which is going to the Commonwealth and we will ever pray as in duty bound

B F Luten
C. H. Smith
W. A. J Attebury
John C. Caorling
Marcus L. Mitchell
G. W. Richmond
A Thomas
G. B. Savens
J. W. Rhoades
John Lochhead
E Rhoades
Wm Adcock

J C Yene
F. J. Barnes
M. D. Mitchuson
James Garnester
Natty Harris
